section.section: The Board consists of 9 members appointed by the Governor with the advice of the Secretary, and with the advice and consent of the Senate.
All Board members shall be residents of the State.

text.section: The members appointed at large shall reasonably reflect the geographic diversity of the State.

section.section: While a member of the Board, a consumer member may not have a substantial financial interest in a person regulated by the Board.

text.section: Before taking office, each appointee to the Board shall take the oath required by Article I, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.

section.section: The term of a member is 4 years.
The terms of members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board on July 1, 2012.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member may not serve more than 2 consecutive terms.

text.section:
For each vacancy of a licensed environmental health specialist member, the Board shall:
Solicit nominations by notifying all licensed environmental health specialists of the vacancy; and
Submit to the Secretary a list of at least three candidates for each vacancy.
On the recommendation of the Secretary, the Governor may remove a member for incompetence, misconduct, neglect of duty, or other sufficient cause.
